N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 118.2 - Program plans

State Regulations

Each school district which is responsible for the provision
of educational services pursuant to Education Law, section 3202(7) shall submit
a plan for the approval of the commissioner no later than July 15th of each
school year, except that for the 1986-87 school year, such plan shall be
submitted no later than November 21, 1986. Such plan shall consist of a
narrative description of the content and scope of the educational programs and
services available to students in the correctional facility, including, but not
limited to, the following: (a) evaluation procedures used; (b) instructional programs available, including a description of how available
programs will be modified, if necessary, to address the special needs of
students identified pursuant to section
118.3
of this Part as in need of a
more intensive program of educational services and of students with limited

English proficiency; (c) qualifications of the instructional staff, including but not limited to, teaching certificates or licenses held and relevant experience with populations
similar to the youth incarcerated; (d) estimated number of full-time equivalent
students to be served in the school year and the estimated expense per
student; (e) anticipated dates of
commencement and termination of the program; (f) whether the program will be a full-day or
half-day program; (g) procedures
for the coordination of the district's educational services with other
appropriate support services provided by the county; (h) procedures for notifying the department
and the school district responsible for the educational costs of a student that
a request for educational services has been received; and
(i) procedures for assisting the correctional
facility in providing incarcerated youth who are being released or discharged
from the facility information identifying the educational and other related
services which may be available to a student after release or discharge, and
the school district in which the student is entitled to attend school upon
release or discharge. Notes
